content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one for learning the basics of For-If combinations. 
Besides, giving basic knowledge about endocrinology is always great for a concrete use case of the code !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quite fun, a good entry for code size puzzles as it would teach some of it's basics. Plus it's educationnal value beyond just code makes it a great knowledge nugget.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a nice clash, that is pretty simple, but interesting enough to be fun. It also teaches some things about gynecology and endocrinology which is very cool. :)

This is a nice clash, that's pretty simple, but the statement is "scary" in its current form.

Clashers will often just quit when they see a clash that looks too hard to understand, which would be a shame for this one.

I'd rewrite the first two paragraphs as below:

An ovulation predictor kit (OPK) can be used to predict fertility. This is signalled by a rise in luteinising hormone (LH), 24-36h before ovulation. The days before the LH surge, where estrogen levels are elevated, are also considered highly fertile. 

Your task is to write the software for an OPK. It needs to provide output for [[N]] days of measurements. Each day your program receives the measured levels of [[estrogen]] (in pg/ml) and [[LH]] (in mIU/ml).

If [[LH]] exceeds the threshold of {{50.0 mIU/ml}}, your program should output {{Peak fertility}}.
Otherwise, if [[estrogen]] exceeds the threshold of {{100.0 pg/ml}}, your program should output {{High fertility}}.
If neither value exceeds the threshold, output {{Low fertility}}.

I think by simplifying some of the distracting information and splitting up the important information into separate lines (as above), it should make the clash seem a lot more approachable.

I'd be happy to approve after you edit. :)
Well, you're probably right - I liked the term oocyte, but it probably isn't really helping with the statement complexity. It should be a bit simpler to understand now. Thanks for your help :)

Yeah, I get that urge in my clashes too, but you have to balance the didactic with the practical in the end.
PS I see from your profile that you're older than me! Cool to see a quattuordecimillenarian on CodinGame. :)
